title: Educational Program Based on Protection Motivation Theory for Strengthening Adolescents' Personal Information Management Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Includes a personal information risk assessment simulation using data analysis linked to mathematics curricula.

learning_goals: Learners can identify personal information leakage risk factors with 80% accuracy.
Learners can establish pre- and post-response strategies by applying a decision-making model based on Protection Motivation Theory.
Learners can create a personal information management plan considering the interaction between self-efficacy and perceived vulnerability.
Learners can quantify personal information leakage risks using math-based data analysis.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
